post.body: But, at least I know that none of that is what Christmas is all about. And that is what makes it bearable. But I'll be honest, still sucks.
And even though I won't open a single present, and I have nothing to look forward to tomorrow, I brought presents with me for my wife & son.
And even if the tree I put up is over 750 miles away, and the next time I see it I'm taking it down to burn, my son is only 3ft away.
And though my back feels like broken glass after 30 hours, and I have a rock hard mattress to sleep on, at least I'm under a roof.
Others are less fortunate, so I can't complain much, even if I am in the middle of nowhere surrounded by ppl whose names I don't know.
I've had bad holidays. I've had some real doozies. This takes the cake. I'm here for a funeral, btw.
I don't know anybody, after 10 minutes with my son I haven't seen in 4 days, someone grabbed him who's "been dieing to hold the baby."
I've arrived. I travelled for 30 hours, and after 15 minutes here, I'm ready to go home. This sucks. This REALLY sucks.
Merry Christmas movie house!
Goin' to Kansas City... Kansas City here I come.
You would think driving 6 hours in any direction would lead out of Indiana. You'd be wrong.
Aw crud, I knew this day would come. I tried to escape Indiana, and they closed all the escape routes! Let me out!
I have to go, but I will pick the story up a bit later.
One place always had a poker game going on. It was real mixed. Lots of bi girls, so as young men, it was the fun place to hang out.
Free beer, good looking women, etc. And sometimes you came across a "family" party. We'd make a beeline out, to their amusement.
I travelled a lot. I often went to college towns and partied there. Gays were always partying. My friends would go apt to apt meeting people
As a young adult, I partied very hard. I drank, smoked a little pot, and have forgotten most of the names of the people I partied with.
I was born to a single mom, I have a black brother, and I went to prison young, and I spent time in a group home for kids.
I have had in my life close bi and gay friends, some dieing of AIDS, much like Rick Warren. My life is a patchwork history.
I think I need to clear the air for any readers. I haven't yet gotten any responses attacking me as a gay basher, but I suppose eventually.
